user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_finish_threads:
```c
void metal_finish_threads(int threads, void *tids)
{
	int i;
	pthread_t *tid_p = (pthread_t *)tids;

	if (!tids) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "invalid argument, tids is NULL.\n");
		return;
	}

	for (i = 0; i < threads; i++)
		(void)pthread_join(tid_p[i], NULL);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_finish_threads:
static int condition(void)
{
	int ret;
	int ts_created;
	pthread_t tids[THREADS];

	/** TC1 consumer threads go first */
	/** create 10 consumer threads first */
	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** create 10 producer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** wait for consumer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);

	/** TC2 producer threads go first */
	/** create 10 producer threads first */
	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** create 10 consumer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

out:
	/** wait for producer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);
	return ret;
}
...
int metal_run(int threads, metal_thread_t child, void *arg)
{
	pthread_t tids[threads];
	int error, ts_created;

	error = metal_run_noblock(threads, child, arg, tids, &ts_created);

	metal_finish_threads(ts_created, (void *)tids);

	return error;
}
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No unreachable code: the error handling uses a conditional goto to the existing label 'out', and the metal_log macro expands to a conditional call but does not prevent subsequent code from being reachable. Therefore the fragment does not introduce unreachable code.
